1. This road sign means:
2. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: go through as soon as the first train passes.
column6: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.
column8: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column10: go through when one of the tracks is free.

column2: 3. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must not make a right turn.
column6: they must make a left turn at the intersection.

column2: 4. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.
5. Motorcyclists are entitled to use the full width of a traffic lane; therefore, a driver should pass a motorcycle the same way as passing another vehicle.
6. This road sign means:
column6: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column8: A road joins from the left

column2: 7. This road sign means:
8. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the type of beverage you drink.
column8: the amount of alcohol you drink.

column2: 9. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 10. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
11. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
12. This sign is used to warn drivers about:
13. This sign means:
column6: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column10: The road will curve to the right.

column2: 14. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
15. This road sign means:
16. This road sign means:
column4: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection
column6: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
column8: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 17. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column6: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.

column2: 18. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column8: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 19. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
20. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.
column10: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.

column2: 21. This sign warns drivers that:
column10: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 22. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a low place in the road.

column2: 23. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
24. This sign means:
25. This road sign means:
26. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column8: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column10: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.

column2: 27. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look into the left side mirror.
column6: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column8: look into the right side mirror.

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column4: Trucks have the right of way

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles
column10: You must make a complete stop

column2: 30. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
31. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column4: It is not recommended to check

column2: 32. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
column6: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.
column8: Be prepared to stop for the red light.

column2: 33. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column8: You should look over your shoulder instead.
column10: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 34. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: quickly change speed or lane position.
column6: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.
column8: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.

column2: 35. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must stay on the right side of the divider
column6: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.
column10: there is a right turn ahead.

column2: 36. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column4: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 37. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column6: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column8: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column10: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.

column2: 38. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column8: you are not allowed to park here.
column10: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.

column2: 39. If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
40. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column8: traffic from all four directions must stop.
